The right to self-determination also has its economic content which gives the people the right to freely ‘dispose of their natural wealth and resources without prejudice to any obligations arising out of international economic cooperation, based upon the principle of mutual benefit, and international law.'

Premise: Self-determination is a basic collective human right. Catalans practiced this right in 2017. Ignoring this conflict within the core of Europe by European Institutions can undermine the EU at its very start.  If you sincerely believe in human rights, recognize the Catalan Republic officially. Conclusion: We should reduce animal farming.
Premise: We can work together to encourage plant based diets and make the world a better place.

Conclusion: We should strengthen Frontex and control immigration
Premise: Bigger financial resources for Frontex and military action in Syria will stop immigration.

Conclusion: We should promote collaborative civic technologies for enhancing citizen participation as an added value to collaborative urban processes
Premise: Civic technologies can support the co-creation, co-production, and co-management of public services with citizens and the development of the urban commoning approach.

Conclusion: We should protect the European border.
Premise: Frontex is the way to protect the European border. It should completely take over every border, land, sea, and air. Otherwise, it will just take over all the good personnel of a member state, causing even more problems at the border.

Conclusion: We should abolish the 996 overtime system
Premise: Corporate management seeks to maximize profits, and China's 996 overtime system can reduce operating costs, especially labor costs.

Conclusion: We should protect our privacy in the Internet age.
Premise: The data provided by privacy can be used to analyze user preferences and needs, and can quickly learn about the shortcomings of the product, correspondingly update more business models, and help achieve business improvement. Help companies gain greater competitiveness.

Conclusion: Carbon emissions trading should be limited.
Premise: Since China's reform and opening up, its economy has developed rapidly, and Western countries have taken advantage of the warming climate to limit the issue of carbon emission rights in order to delay China's development.
